channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Swiss voters reject proposed tax on super rich
item.description: Switzerland on Sunday overwhelmingly rejected a proposed 50 per cent tax on inherited fortunes of 50 million Swiss francs ($62 million) or more, with 78 per cent of votes against the plan, an outcome that even exceeded the two‑thirds opposition indicated in polls. Bankers have watched the vote clo

item.title: Pope removes shoes but doesn't pray on visit to Istanbul's Blue Mosque
item.description: Pope Leo visited Istanbul's Blue Mosque on Saturday, removing his shoes in a sign of respect but not appearing to pray in his first visit as leader of the Catholic Church to a Muslim place of worship during his four-day visit to Turkey. The first US pope bowed slightly before entering the mosque a

item.title: Well-known faces to join the royals for Princess Kate's annual carol service
item.description: Actors Kate Winslet, Hannah Waddingham and Chiwetel Ejiofor will be among the stars joining the British royals for the annual Christmas carol service at London's Westminster Abbey hosted by Kate, the Princess of Wales, her office said on Saturday. The 'Together At Christmas' service, which will be

item.title: Zelensky's 'man for all seasons' ensnared in corruption probe
item.description: Ask Ukrainians who the country's most powerful figure is after the president and many will say Andriy Yermak, his chief of staff and a key negotiator during four years of war when Western financial and military aid has kept Kyiv in the fight. Yermak, a friend of President Volodymyr Zelensky and hi

item.title: British globe trekker faces changed world on final leg of 27-year journey
item.description: Karl Bushby, a British ex-paratrooper who set out in 1998 to walk around the world, is on the final stretch of his 27-year-long trek home, and trying to cope with social media pressure in a world that has changed profoundly. Walking in pouring rain in northwest Hungary, Bushby, 56, who started out

item.title: Russia says its proposals on New START arms treaty are intended to prevent negative global scenarios
item.description: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said on Wednesday that Moscow's proposals regarding the New START nuclear arms control treaty are designed to prevent negative global scenarios. Earlier, President Putin offered to voluntarily uphold the limits capping the size of the world's two larg

item.title: Paris court: Hearing on request for Shein's suspension in France postponed to Dec 5
item.description: The hearing on the French government's request that Chinese online platform Shein be suspended in France for three months over sales of childlike sex dolls and banned weapons, has been postponed to December 5, a Paris court said on Wednesday. Shein has already disabled its marketplace - where thir

item.title: French poll shows far-right leader Bardella winning presidential election
item.description: French pollster Odoxa predicted for the first time that 30-year-old far-right leader Jordan Bardella would win the next presidential election, scheduled in 2027, no matter who his opponents would be. The current president of far-right National Rally (RN) party, and heir to long-time leader Marine

item.title: BBC not ‘institutionally biased’: memo author
item.description: The author of a report that plunged the BBC into crisis said the broadcaster was not "institutionally biased", and he had hoped his criticisms would lead to improvements. Michael Prescott, a former editorial advisor, compiled a dossier on issues within BBC News, including failings in the editing o

item.title: Spain exhumes victim of Franco-era killings in ongoing recovery effort
item.description: Jose Luis Cubo watched as forensic scientists dug up the body of a man his grandfather had helped to bury at the start of the Spanish Civil War in 1936 after an execution by fascist forces. The remains pulled from a muddy pit in Vegas de Matute farmland, 75 km (47 miles) north of Madrid, are

item.title: Ukraine says it received 1,000 bodies from Russia
item.description: Ukraine received 1,000 bodies of what Russia says are fallen Ukrainian servicemen, Kyiv's prisoner-of-war coordination centre said on Thursday. "Investigators from law enforcement bodies, together with expert agencies of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, will soon conduct all necessary examination

item.title: Europeans push back at US plan that would force concessions from Ukraine
item.description: European countries pushed back on Thursday against a US-backed peace plan for Ukraine that sources said would require Kyiv to give up more land and partially disarm, conditions long seen by Ukraine's allies as tantamount to capitulation. Two people familiar with the matter told Reuters on Wednesda

item.title: Netanyahu officially asks Israeli president for pardon
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has submitted an official request for his pardon to Israeli President Isaac Herzog, the Israeli president's office said on Sunday. "The Office of the President is aware that this is an extraordinary request which carries with it significant implications. A

item.title: Rahul, Sonia Gandhi face conspiracy charges in National Herald case
item.description: Rahul Gandhi and his mother Sonia Gandhi have been booked on charges of criminal conspiracy in a fresh FIR in connection with the National Herald money laundering case, Indian media report. Filed by the Delhi Police’s Economic Offences Wing (EOW), and registered on Oct 3, the FIR names six i

item.title: Myanmar citizens abroad ‘welcome to return’, junta chief says
item.description: Myanmar junta leader has said citizens living in the United States and other countries will be welcomed if they wish to return. The announcement came after the United States ended temporary protected status for nearly 4,000 Myanmar nationals earlier this week. Irrawaddy reported that speaking at

item.title: Myanmar junta invites citizens abroad to return
item.description: Myanmar junta leader has said citizens living in the United States and other countries will be welcomed if they wish to return. The announcement came after the United States ended temporary protected status for nearly 4,000 Myanmar nationals earlier this week. Irrawaddy reported that speaking at

item.title: Indonesia flood death toll climbs to 303 amid cyclone devastation, disaster agency says
item.description: The death toll from floods and landslides following cyclonic rains in the Indonesian island of Sumatra has risen to 303, the head of the country's disaster mitigation agency said on Saturday, up from a previous figure of 174 dead. Large parts of Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand have been stricken

item.title: How does the Hong Kong tower fire compare to other recent building blazes?
item.description:
A blaze that ripped through a massive apartment block in Hong Kong has claimed at least 128 lives, with 150 people still missing, surpassing the toll of a similar incident at London's Grenfell Tower in 2017.
Here is how the disaster compares to some other major building fire incidents arou

item.title: Hong Kong mourns victims of blaze that killed 128 and counting
item.description: Hong Kong on Saturday mourned the 128 people known to have died in a massive fire at a high-rise apartment complex, a toll that is likely to rise with 150 still missing days after the disaster.Authorities have arrested 11 people in connection with the city's worst blaze in nearly 80 years as they i

item.title: Nepal issues new Rs 100 note showing ‘Indian territories’
item.description: Nepal’s central bank on Thursday unveiled new Rs 100 currency notes featuring a revised national map that includes the disputed Kalapani, Lipulekh, and Limpiyadhura regions, territories India has long maintained are its own, reports The Times of India. The move revives a years-long boundary

item.title: Death toll from Hong Kong’s fire rises to 128
item.description: Hong Kong on Saturday mourned the 128 people known to have died in a massive fire at a high-rise apartment complex, a toll that is likely to rise, with 200 others still unaccounted for days after the disaster. Authorities have arrested 11 people in connection with the city's worst blaze in nearly

item.title: Israeli raid in southern Syria leaves 13 dead
item.description: Thirteen people were killed in an Israeli raid in southern Syria on Friday, Syrian state media reported, with Damascus accusing Israel of a "criminal attack" in a village where Israel said its troops came under fire during an operation to arrest militants. The Israeli military said six soldiers we

item.title: UAE halts visas for Pakistanis
item.description: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has stopped issuing visas to Pakistani citizens, Interior Ministry official Salman Chaudhry has told a Senate committee, citing concerns over “misuse” of visit visas. Dawn reported Chaudhry’s remarks to the Senate Functional Committee on Human Right

item.title: Venezuela revokes flight rights for six airlines amid escalating US tensions
item.description: Venezuela has revoked operating rights for six major international airlines which suspended flights to the country following a warning from the US Federal Aviation Administration. The civil aviation authority revoked permits for Iberia, TAP, Avianca, Latam Colombia, Turkish Airlines and Gol, which
